section.name: UNIT 5: ENERGY USE AND SOCIETY
section.summary:
Principle 6: The amount of energy used by human society depends on many factors.

This principle explores our energy consumption, including:

    • the role of conservation
    • human demand for energy
    • the limited nature of energy resources
    • the impact of innovations on energy use

Principle 7: The quality of life of individuals and societies is affected by energy choices.

This principle makes direct connections between energy use and quality of life. Factors affecting individuals and society's quality of life include:

    • economic security
    • national security
    • environmental quality
    • dependence on fossil fuels
    • access to energy resources
    • vulnerability to impacts of energy choices
